alert.note: Alert for Central Highlands; East Central Plains; Middle Rio Grande Valley; North Central Mountains; Northeast Highlands; Northeast Plains; Northwest Plateau; Sandia and Manzano Mountains; Sangre de Cristo Mountains; Upper Rio Grande Valley and Lower Chama River Valley (New Mexico) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Albuquerque (Northern and Central New Mexico)
info.headline: Fire Weather Watch issued April 19 at 2:32AM MDT until April 20 at 8:00PM MDT by NWS Albuquerque
info.description: ..RED FLAG WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM 10 AM TO 10 PM MDT TODAY FOR ALL OF NORTHERN AND CENTRAL NEW MEXICO BELOW SNOWPACK DUE TO STRONG WINDS, VERY LOW RELATIVE HUMIDITY AND AN UNSTABLE ATMOSPHERE... ...FIRE WEATHER WATCH IN EFFECT FROM THURSDAY AFTERNOON THROUGH THURSDAY EVENING FOR MUCH OF NORTHERN AND CENTRAL NEW MEXICO BELOW SNOWPACK DUE TO STRONG WINDS, VERY LOW RELATIVE HUMIDITY AND AN UNSTABLE ATMOSPHERE... .Critical fire weather conditions continue today through Thursday due to strong southwest to northwest winds, very low humidity and an unstable atmosphere. As many as 10 consecutive hours of single digit humidity values expected today over eastern New Mexico and the Middle Rio Grande Valley with poor overnight humidity recovery tonight over all but the Northeast Plains. Widespread critical fire weather conditions will persist Thursday with prolonged single digit humidity favoring areas along and south of I-40, but temperatures will be 5-15 degrees cooler than normal area wide. ...RED FLAG WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM 10 AM THIS MORNING TO 10 PM MDT THIS EVENING... ...FIRE WEATHER WATCH IN EFFECT FROM THURSDAY AFTERNOON THROUGH THURSDAY EVENING... The National Weather Service in Albuquerque has issued a Fire Weather Watch...which is in effect from Thursday afternoon through Thursday evening. * AREA AND TIMING...Northwest Plateau (Zone 101), Upper Rio Grande and Lower Chama River Valley (Zone 121), North Central Mountains (Zone 120) below significant snowpack, Sangre de Cristo Mountains below significant snowpack (Zone 122), Middle Rio Grande Valley (Zone 106), Sandia and Manzano Mountains (Zone 124), Northeast Highlands (Zone 123), Northeast Plains (Zone 104), Central Highlands (Zone 125) and East Central Plains (Zone 126) from 10 AM to 10 PM MDT Today. * 20 FOOT WINDS...Southwest to west 25 to 35 mph with gusts to 55 mph today. Northwest 25 to 35 mph with gusts to 55 mph Thursday. * RELATIVE HUMIDITY...Around 6 to 12 percent at the lower elevations Today and Thursday. Around 15 to 22 percent above 8500 feet in the North Central and Sangre de Cristo Mountains Today and Thursday. * IMPACTS...Any fires that develop will likely spread rapidly. Outdoor burning is not recommended.
info.instruction: Please advise the appropriate officials or fire crews in the field of this Red Flag Warning. Please advise the appropriate officials or fire crews in the field of this Fire Weather Watch.

area.areaDesc: Central Highlands; East Central Plains; Middle Rio Grande Valley; North Central Mountains; Northeast Highlands; Northeast Plains; Northwest Plateau; Sandia and Manzano Mountains; Sangre de Cristo Mountains; Upper Rio Grande Valley and Lower Chama River Valley
